conversation.text: Hello, are you ready to cook?
Yes, please. Now, how do I get some pasta, sauce, and peppers to cook?
conversation.chosenReferece: Yes, please. Now, how do I get some pasta, sauce, and peppers to cook?

conversation.text: We are pickling eggs today.
Okay. Thanks. It looks really good.
conversation.chosenReferece: Okay. Thanks. It looks really good.

conversation.text: Please pop some eggs on to boil and boil for 20 minutes
Ok, then what do I do?
Please cool the eggs off and then peel the egg shell. Be careful, they will be hot.
evidence: peel the eggshell off the cooled eggs

conversation.text: OK, that was easy. I love peeling eggs.
Do you have a large sterilized jar ready?
evidence: Place the peeled eggs into a sterilized large jar.

conversation.text: Yes, I believe I have a large glass jar right here. It is my mum's old jar that she pickled in.
conversation.chosenReferece: Yes, I believe I have a large glass jar right here. What type is it? Is it clear? Purple? You tell me. Thank

conversation.text: That's great. Next step is the vinegar. We need to add it to the saucepan with the dry ingredients.
evidence: half of the vinegar into a saucepan

conversation.text: What do you mean the dry ingredients? I have the hot water.
conversation.chosenReferece: What do you mean the dry ingredients? I have the hot water. And I'm on my way. Thanks. You are my cooking teacher. I could

conversation.text: The dry ingredients are the peppercorns, allspice and ginger. Add them to the vinegar.
Ok, I think I have them all. Should I add that? And what's the last step?
conversation.chosenReferece: Ok, I think I have them all. Should I add that? And what's the last step? User is cooking eggs with an agent. As for t

conversation.text: Yes, add them to the vinegar and bring to the boil for about ten minutes. This is where is smells strong! How does yours look?
evidence: Add the peppercorns, allspice and ginger to the vinegar

conversation.text: Mine smells lovely and is almost ready. I am looking forward to eating pickles eggs.
Ok, brilliant. You're doing really well. The next step is to pour the vinegar over the eggs.
evidence: Pour the hot vinegar over the eggs.

conversation.text: Thank you. Do I seal the jar?
Yes, cover the jar but only once it is cooled.
Is that all? Thanks for teaching me. I will let you know if I have further questions. Bye. Thanks again. Goodbye
conversation.chosenReferece: Is that all? Thanks for teaching me. I will let you know if I have further questions. Bye. Thanks again. Goodbye

conversation.text: Yes, that is all. Now all you have to do is refrigerate and eat within a month. Yum! Well done.
evidence: Store in the refrigerator for at least one week before consuming. Keep refrigerated for up to one month.

conversation.text: Brilliant! Bye! Thanks for the help.
Enjoy your eggs! Bye!
evidence: Keep refrigerated for up to one month.

conversation.text: Goodbye. Bye! You're welcome. Take care. [Sign-off]
conversation.chosenReferece: Goodbye. Bye! You're welcome. Take care. [Sign-off]

conversation.text: Goodbye, thanks for cooking with me.
Bye. See you later Agent. Byye! Byuo! See yuu later! [Sign off] Goodbye, than
conversation.chosenReferece: Bye. See you later Agent. Byye! Byuo! See yuu later! [Sign off] Goodbye, than

procedure.description: They must be very hard boiled.

procedure.summary: Remove from the hot water and set aside to cool.
procedure.description:
Then, peel the eggshell off the cooled eggs. To peel, gently knock each egg against the side of a bowl or something similar to create cracks. Use your fingers to pry open a small hole, then peel off the eggshell in pieces. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/50\/Pickle-Eggs-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Pickle-Eggs-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/50\/Pickle-Eggs-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Pickle-Eggs-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

procedure.summary: Place the peeled eggs into a sterilized large jar.
Pour about half of the vinegar into a saucepan.
procedure.description: Add the peppercorns, allspice and ginger to the vinegar. Bring to the boil for about 10 minutes.

procedure.summary: Pour the hot vinegar over the eggs.

procedure.description:
Then cover with the lid. Store in the refrigerator for at least one week before consuming.
